title: Quiz 6: Interpersonal & Community Models
topicName: Principles & Practice of Health Promotion I
description: Assess knowledge of Social Cognitive Theory, Diffusion of Innovations, and the PRECEDE-PROCEED model.

questions.question: Which concept in Social Cognitive Theory (SCT) describes the dynamic interaction between the person, behavior, and environment?
questions.explanation: Reciprocal determinism asserts that personal factors, environmental factors, and behavior all influence each other.
questions.hint: It means the influence goes back and forth.

questions.question: Match the Diffusion of Innovations attribute to its key question:

pairs.right: Is it better than what it replaces?
Does it fit with the intended audience?
Can it be tried before adopting?

questions.explanation: Advantage = Better; Compatibility = Fit; Complexity = Ease; Trialability = Testing.
questions.hint: Think about why you would buy a new phone.

questions.question: In the PRECEDE-PROCEED model, PRECEDE stands for: ___BLANK___, Reinforcing, and Enabling Constructs in Educational/Environmental Diagnosis and Evaluation.
questions.explanation: The 'P' in PRECEDE stands for Predisposing factors (knowledge, attitudes, beliefs).
questions.hint: Factors that exist BEFORE the behavior.

questions.question: Order the adopter categories in Diffusion of Innovations from earliest to latest:
questions.explanation: Innovators -> Early Adopters -> Early Majority -> Late Majority -> Laggards.
questions.hint: The curve starts with the risk-takers and ends with the skeptics.

questions.question: Which of the following are levels in the Ecological Model? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: The Ecological Model typically includes Individual, Interpersonal, Institutional, Community, and Policy levels.
questions.hint: Think of concentric circles expanding from the individual.

questions.question: In the PRECEDE-PROCEED model, what type of factors include available resources, supportive policies, assistance, and services?
questions.explanation: Enabling factors allow persons to act on their predispositions (e.g., availability, access, skills).

questions.question: Which concept describes 'behavioral acquisition that occurs by watching the actions and outcomes of others'?
questions.explanation: Observational learning (or modeling) is learning by watching others.

questions.question: The PROCEED phase of the model deals with the implementation and evaluation of the program.
questions.explanation: True. PRECEDE is diagnostic/planning; PROCEED is implementation/evaluation.

questions.question: In Communication Theory, 'Media Agenda Setting' refers to:

options.text: Factors influencing how media select and emphasize issues
How advocacy groups package a story

questions.explanation: Media agenda setting defines what issues get covered based on institutional factors and processes.
questions.hint: What the news decides to show.

questions.question: Which diagnostic step in PRECEDE identifies the health problems most important to the community (prioritizing needs)?
questions.explanation: Epidemiological Assessment documents and prioritizes health problems using data.
